title: How to Make Apple Pudding

steps.headline: Pre-heat the oven at 350 degrees F or 175 degrees C.
Peel the skin off from the apples and remove the cores.
Use a shredder to shred the apples and scatter lemon juice on top.
Mix the egg yolks in a medium sized bowl until airy.
Slowly mix in the sugar, continuing to mix as the mixture thickens.
Add in the apple/lemon juice mix, matzo meal, and raisins.
Mix the egg whites rapidly, in a separate bowl, until firm but not dry.
Add the whites into the batter slowly to the mixture.
Transfer to a 2 1/2 quart casserole dish, that has been pre-greased with cooking spray or oil.
Put the casserole in the oven and let it bake for about 40 minutes.
steps.description: Serve the pudding while still hot.

text: Pre-heat the oven at 350 degrees F or 175 degrees C.  Peel the skin off from the apples and remove the cores.  Use a shredder to shred the apples and scatter lemon juice on top. Place this on the side. Mix the egg yolks in a medium sized bowl until airy.  Slowly mix in the sugar, continuing to mix as the mixture thickens.  Add in the apple/lemon juice mix, matzo meal, and raisins.  Mix the egg whites rapidly, in a separate bowl, until firm but not dry.  Add the whites into the batter slowly to the mixture.  Transfer to a 2 1/2 quart casserole dish, that has been pre-greased with cooking spray or oil.  Put the casserole in the oven and let it bake for about 40 minutes. Serve the pudding while still hot. Finished.
